modules.description: This module enables seamless interaction between OCaml and Lua by offering type-safe stack operations, buffer management, and error propagation. It handles Lua states, stack values, and userdata through utilities for argument validation, string manipulation, reference tracking, and metaprogramming, while supporting tasks like script execution, module registration, and resource cleanup. Key use cases include embedding Lua interpreters in OCaml applications, safely exchanging data between the two languages, and implementing Lua extensions with robust error handling.

This module facilitates interaction between OCaml and the Lua virtual machine through stack-based operations, type conversions, and state management. It provides low-level access to Lua's core functionalities—such as manipulating Lua values (tables, functions, threads, userdata), inspecting and transforming stack elements, and handling garbage collection—while enabling seamless bridging between OCaml and Lua representations. Typical use cases include embedding Lua scripts in OCaml applications, extending Lua with custom OCaml-implemented functions, and managing Lua environments or coroutines programmatically.
